then.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: at a particular time in the past or future
then.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: I wish I had known then what I know now.
It was then that I realised she’d tricked me.
He started his career in St Petersburg – or Leningrad as it then was.
They met in 1942 and from then on (=starting at that time) they were firm friends.
Silently she closed the door. Just then she heard a noise.
I was paid £1,000, which was a lot of money back then (=a long time ago when things were different) in the 1950s.
They’re sending out the results next week, so we won’t know anything until then.
It was late evening when the doctor arrived, and by then it was too late.
That was in 1970. Since then the place has changed a lot.
then.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: used to say what happens next or what you do next
then.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Mix the flour and butter, then add the eggs.
Byron travelled to Italy and then to Greece.
then.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: used when saying what the result of a situation or action will be
then.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: If you won’t tell him, then I will.
Start off early, then you won’t have to rush.
then.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: used when you think that something is probably true because of what you know about the situation
then.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Still in your pyjamas? Have you just got out of bed then?
then.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: used at the beginning of a conversation or activity
then.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Now then, what would you like to do today?
then.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: used at the end of a conversation, especially to show that something has been agreed
then.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: Good, that’s settled then. We’ll all meet here next Wednesday.
Okay then, I’ll see you at work.
then.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: used to show that you are saying something because of what someone has just said
then.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: used to add something to what you have just mentioned
then.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: We have to invite your parents and my parents, and then there’s your brother.
then.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: used to refer back to what you have just been talking about
then.translation[0].definitions[8].examp: This then was the situation facing the government at the end of the war.
then.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: used when mentioning the person who had a particular job, title, or position at a time in the past
then.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: a visit to China by the then US President, Richard Nixon
